item.title: Timbuk2 + Blue Bottle's Sabbatical Travel Kit
item.description:
Timbuk2 + Blue Bottle's Sabbatical Travel Kit

If the recent buyouts of Intelligentsia and Stumptown are any indication, the growing popularity of craft coffee shows no signs of slowing down. While single origin pour-overs are now commonplace in many coffeeshops, sometimes when you're off the beaten path, your morning cup of coffee is harder to perfect.

item.title: Brooklyn's Luft Coffee
item.description:
Brooklyn's Luft Coffee

About five years ago, Blair Smith's twice-a-day coffee pitstop at NYC's Kaffe 1668 led to him striking up a friendship with barista Justin Rodriguez behind the counter. Smith then met mobile developer Aaron Sutula in a coffee seminar held by an espresso machine company. "I took a day off of work to go," remembers Sutula.

item.title: A Disney space station? It no longer seems like such a goofy idea
item.description:
A Disney space station? It no longer seems like such a goofy idea

Throughout our planet's space-faring history, there have been two major impediments to putting a lot of private citizens into orbit. Only governments have had spacecraft, and there have been only a few, government-controlled, space stations to visit. But now that may finally changing in a big way.

item.title: Airbnb's Coolest Tiny Houses in America
item.description:
Airbnb's Coolest Tiny Houses in America

Tiny homes are all the rage, so it makes perfect sense that tiny homes people list on Airbnb are also quite popular. And that's…

item.title: 7 Gadgets That'll Actually Get You Excited to Work Out
item.description:
7 Gadgets That'll Actually Get You Excited to Work Out

Gadgets and devices that make working out more enjoyable, including games, music players, and muscle trackers.

item.title: Apple Challenges Government Demand To Crack Drug Dealer's iPhone In New York
item.description:
Apple Challenges Government Demand To Crack Drug Dealer's iPhone In New York

Apple has formally challenged the U.S. Department of Justice over another locked iPhone and the encrypted information it contains. Owned by an accused methamphetamine distributor in Brooklyn, the iPhone 5s is believed to contain evidence of a drug conspiracy, investigators said. The government claims that its technicians can't penetrate the locked iPhone and require Apple's help to get inside.

item.title: 50 Apps and Websites to Optimize Your Vacation
item.description:
50 Apps and Websites to Optimize Your Vacation

Everyone has an airport horror story. But you can make the most of a bad situation with apps like Flight+, which will keep you abreast of the latest delays and gate changes. And if you need a shower, unlimited Wi-Fi, or a work space during your extended layover, LoungeBuddy will alert you as to which free and pay-as-you-go lounges are available.
